intro: Geniostoma pachyphyllum, commonly known as the thick-leaved geniostoma, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that help it store water, adapting it to arid environments. Its flowers are typically showy, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Geniostoma pachyphyllum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and attractive blooms.
